concept.title: Merging Streams
concept.shortdesc: You can merge streams of data in a pipeline by connecting two or more stages to the same downstream stage. When you merge streams of data, the channels the data from all streams to the same stage, but does not perform a join of records in the stream.

conbody.p: For example, in the following pipeline, the stage named Routes Data sends data with null values to Replaces Null Values for null replacement. The pipeline merges data from Routes Data and Replaces Null Values at the Field-Level Expressions stage so expressions are performed on all data.
conbody.note: The pipeline validation does not prevent duplicate data. To avoid writing duplicate data to destinations, configure pipeline logic to remove duplicate data or prevent the generation of duplicate data.
